page.title: 14Gourdon Summer Fete
page.content: {Gourdon Community Council}held its first ever fete in Boath Park in the summer of 1985. It was very well supported and attended by local people there being something to interest young and old alike. Both the{fire {service and the coastguard service were in attendance to give demonstrations of their vehicles and the work they carry out. A{fairground {organ}provided much appreciated music throughout the afternoon. There were a variety of{stalls and side shows,}the {trampoline}proving to be very popular as was the{throwing of wet sponges at {the local headmaster and policeman when they took their turn at the Aunt Sally Stand. The day was rounded off with a dance and barbecue in the evening.
